articles.title: Blizzard conditions swallow parts of major highways in Midwest
articles.description: Travel isn't any easier for drivers in the Midwest. The winter storm caused whiteout conditions from Nebraska to Illinois, forcing some major highways to shut down. Dean Reynolds reports.

articles.title: Flight cancellations and delays continue amid Midwest winter storm
articles.description: A nasty winter storm is making it difficult for people returning to the Midwest after the Thanksgiving holiday. More than 1,200 flights were canceled Sunday, and more than 5,000 others were delayed on one of the busiest travel days of the year. Kris Van Cleav…

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Cyber Monday and Black Friday merge into one big shopping holiday
articles.description: From in-store doorbusters to armchair browsing, the 5-day Thanksgiving weekend is blending into one giant shopathon
articles.content: The physical rush of Black Friday and the armchair browsing of Cyber Monday are increasingly blending into one big holiday shopping event as more customers buy items online and pick them up at brick-and-mortar stores. Adobe Analytics reported Saturday that mo… [+2401 chars]

articles.title: Chinese researcher claims he helped make first gene-edited babies
articles.description: A Chinese researcher has created an international controversy over science and ethics after claiming he helped make the world's first genetically-edited babies. According to the AP, the researcher altered embryos for seven couples during fertility treatments.…

articles.title: Trump says migrants at border "are NOT coming into the U.S.A."
articles.description: Before the midterm elections, the migrant caravan was far away from Mexico. Now it is near the California border and President Trump faces difficult policy questions. Does he try to shut down the border, or does he try to persuade Mexico to allow the migrants…

articles.title: "Last Tango in Paris" director Bernardo Bertolucci dead at 77
articles.description: Filmmaker who explored political and erotic themes in such classics as "The Conformist" and "1900" won two Academy Awards for writing and directing the historical epic "The Last Emperor"
articles.content: ROME - Italian filmmaker Bernardo Bertolucci, who won Oscars with "The Last Emperor" and whose erotic drama "Last Tango in Paris" enthralled and shocked the world, died Monday. He was 77. Bertolucci's press office, Punto e Virgola, confirmed the death in an e… [+7280 chars]

articles.title: The chaos behind Donald Trump's policy of family separation at the border
articles.description: A 60 Minutes investigation has found the separations that dominated headlines this summer began earlier and were greater in number than the Trump administration admits. Scott Pelley reports

articles.title: Robots come to the rescue after Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster

articles.title: Black Friday sales break records ahead of Cyber Monday
articles.description: Holiday shoppers racked up record online sales on Black Friday. According to retail analysts at "Shopper Trak," fewer customers traveled to stores Friday. Could this be a sign of heavy online traffic to come on Cyber Monday? CBS News correspondent Mireya Vill…

articles.title: Saudi crown prince survived fallout of journalist's murder
articles.description: Nearly two months after the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi, it appears the Saudi crown prince hasn’t been held responsible, despite global consensus he was almost certainly involved. CBS News foreign correspondent Holly Williams reports.

articles.title: NASA prepares to land rover on Mars
articles.description: Monday afternoon, NASA will attempt to land a spacecraft on Mars. It has been done before, but the thin Martian atmosphere makes it very difficult. More than half of attempted landings on Mars have failed. CBS News' Chris Martinez reports.

articles.title: Police mistakenly kill young African-American in mall shooting
articles.description: It was a Thanksgiving tragedy: In the confusion of a shooting at a mall in Alabama, the police fatally shot a young African-American man. CBS News correspondent Mark Strassman reports.
